CE 3372 Water Systems Design

Catalog Description

3372. Water Systems Design (3:3:0). Prerequisite: CE 3305, 3354. Hydraulic analysis and design of municipal water distribution, stormwater collection, and wastewater collection systems. Oral and written presentations. (Communication Intensive)

Introduction

Lesson introduces the course, demonstrates the on-line resources available For the course. Reviews the syllabus in the context of ABET requirements. The MOODLE site credentials are provided for students to be able to take assigned quizzes and complete homework assignments. A short presentation of water system types and history is provided.

Lesson Notes   Instructor notes used in face-to-face presentation.

Introduction to Water Resources Engineering Pages 1-33 from Wurbs,R.A., and James, W.P. (2002) Water Resources Engineering, Prentice Hall.

Introduction to Water Resources Engineering Pages 1-11 from Mays, L.W. (2011) Water Resources Engineering, J. Wiley and Sons.

Introduction to Water Resources Engineering Pages 1-8 from Chin, D. A. (2006) Water-Resources Engineering, Pearson-Prentice Hall.

Lesson 1 Part 1 Introduction; Syllabus; Tour of Website(s) (~29 minutes)

Lesson 1 Part 2 Types of Water Systems (~ 20 minutes)

Lesson 1 Part 3 History of Water Systems (Photo Essay) (~27 minutes)

Lesson 1 Section 001 (Evening) Zoom Meeting (recorded 2020-0825) (~80 minutes)

Lesson 1 Section 002 (Morning) Zoom Meeting (recorded 2020-0825) (~70 minutes)
